author: Staff Reporter
text:
A special medical camp for women and children to mark the 68th birthday of Chief Minister Jayalalithaa was inaugurated at Agasteeswaram Primary Health Centre near Nagercoil on Sunday.

Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan inaugurated the camp by lighting a ‘kuthuvilakku’ in the presence of MLAs K.T. Pachaimal and A. Nanjil Murugesan.

Mr. Chavan said that 680 special medical camps would be held across the State between February 21 and 29. Twelve special camps would be held in nine panchayat unions and three municipalities in the district.

Scans and blood tests would be conducted and vaccination for pregnant women would be done. Treatment would be provided for people in need under Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Assistance Scheme in the camps. A total of 120 pregnant women participated in the camp at Agasteeswaram PHC. Order for financial assistance under Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Assistance Scheme was issued to seven women. Deputy Director of Medical Services M. Madhusoodhanan, and Block Medical Officer Vijaya were present.
title: Medical camps held
